content.description: The second climb from the right on the Ort Wall, and the most popular warm-up in the grotto. Big jugs with unnecessary slopers in between, the only difficulty is identifying which holds are good.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  Either bring a sling for the third bolt, skip it, or deal with the drag.

content.description: Juggy pulls for the first half with the crux coming just below bolt 4.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor shared with Misperception.
content.location: Second bolted route from the left between Misperception and Clip, Clip, WOW.

content.description: Fun, but somewhat funky line with some tough open-handed holds. A bit of a sandbag at 11b, especially when the neighboring 10d is a bit inflated.
content.location: From the right, this is the 3rd set of anchors or 4th climb. It is just left of 'Color Coded Quickdraws'.

climbs.name: Cowboy Up
climbs.fa: Matt Schlueter and Daniel Forbes, May 2004

content.description: Route starts a few steps up the talus and trends left to the Sidesaddle anchors using big holds and easy steps over and up.
content.protection: 3 bolts and anchor carabiners for chains.
content.location: Furthest right line of 3 bolts on the Ort Wall, shares an anchor with Sidesaddle.

content.description: The second line of bolts from the right of the Ort Wall.  Pretty straight forward climbing on good holds until the crux near the third bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor

content.description: Clip, Clip, Wow is the third bolted climb from the left on the Ort wall.  It consists of big moves on very big holds on a slightly overhanging face.  Reminds me of gym climbing - but outdoors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  A runner might be nice for the second bolt.
